#Text=ApexSQL September 2020 Newsletter
#Text=ApexSQL September 2020 Newsletter
#Text=Where did the summer go?
#Text=ApexSQL has been chugging along during the whole summer when, in general, many software companies typically tend to slow down a bit.
#Text=Our engineering teams have been hard at work
#Text=bringing great new releases for the majority of our tools, and we'd like to highlight a few of them below:
#Text=What's fresh
#Text=The releases of new products and technologies i.e.
#Text=Visual Studio Code and MySQL is cracking.
#Text=MySQL data compare
#Text=We got a brand new MySQL data comparison and synchronization tool, ApexSQL Data Diff for MySQL.
#Text=This tool can detect data differences between two databases and resolve them without any errors.
#Text=Moreover, it allows users to:
#Text=Compare data between two MySQL databases
#Text=Customize object mapping
#Text=Select specific objects for comparison
#Text=Export comparison results to HTML, Excel, or CSV
#Text=Automate and schedule data synchronization
#Text=Create data synchronization scripts
#Text=Besides MySQL, it also supports Azure Database, Amazon RDS for MySQL and MariaDB.
#Text=The list of
#Text=features is rather long, and therefore we encourage you to see the product update alert for the full list of features.
#Text=Furthermore, here are some key resources to
#Text=help you get started with ApexSQL Data Diff for MySQL:
#Text=Getting started - a collection of resources to begin using ApexSQL Data Diff for MySQL quickly
#Text=Product page - learn more about what the MySQL data compare tool has to offer
#Text=Database Power Tools for VS Code

#Text=The new big thing in ApexSQL Database Power Tools for VS Code 2020 R6 version is the browsable code completion list for inserting MySQL and MariaDB keywords, database, schema, object, parameter, and variable names in the SQL statements AKA IntelliSense.
#Text=This feature speeds up coding by inserting keywords, schemas, objects, etc. while typing queries.
#Text=For more details on the new release, please see the latest product update alert
#Text=What's cooking?
#Text=ApexSQL Audit 2020 R4
#Text=We are pleased to announce significant enhancements coming to the next minor version of our SQL Server audit and compliance solution
#Text=that will include, among other usability and quality improvements, features like:
#Text=Extended session settings - Customizable session settings to manage auditing data collection
#Text=Additional report header options - Extracted reports including more options to formalize the audit documentation
#Text=ApexSQL Manage 2020 R5
#Text=The upcoming version of the SQL Server instance management tool from the ApexSQL DBA family will have a new set of Security
#Text=rules to extend the range of health check analysis.
#Text=This new set of rules will provide DBAs with the possibility to perform high-level analysis to
#Text=test the security of SQL Server instance(s):
#Text=SQL Server files not on NTFS drives
#Text=Dynamic data masking
#Text=Operating system up to date
#Text=Database Master Keys Encrypted by Password
#Text=SQL browser service not enabled
#Text=Symmetric keys encrypted by certificate
#Text=Symmetric keys not created on system databases
#Text=CLR should be disabled
#Text=Common Criteria Compliance
#Text=Max number of concurrent sessions
#Text=Allow Updates to System Tables is disabled
#Text=Default Trace enabled
#Text=Error log files maximum number
#Text=Asymmetric Key Size
#Text=Full-Text search should not be installed
#Text=Hide SQL Instance
#Text=Replication component installed
#Text=Transparent data encryption enabled for databases
#Text=Server does not contain orphaned users
#Text=By executing the above set of rules, the SQL Server is examined and searched for any potential security issues and a comprehensive report is displayed to the DBA.
#Text=Quest Database Training Days Fall Series
#Text=Join the interactive performance tuning sessions delivered by industry experts, Brent Ozar, Janis Griffin, and Pinal Dave.
#Text=The next great opportunity for free SQL Server training from Oracle ACE Director Janis Griffin on the subject "Top Five MySQL Query Tuning Tips" is on September 29.
#Text=Attend this event if you want to learn how to simplify MySQL query tuning.
#Text=See how to monitor and review the execution plan.
#Text=Then, look at the table, column, and index information to
#Text=understand selectivity to find the driving table.
#Text=Finally, find performance inhibitors.
#Text=With her tips, you'll perform MySQL query tuning quickly and easily!
#Text=Use the checkboxes to select the events you wish to attend, then complete the form to register on this link.
#Text=DBA tools discounted at 20%
#Text=Now through September, get 20% off our already affordable tools that help you meet SQL Server
#Text=audit, compliance, and instance management; read SQL transaction logs, and recover data.
#Text=Need
#Text=them all?
#Text=We even have our bundled tools discounted.
#Text=Put them in your shopping cart and buy it now:
#Text=ApexSQL Audit: Meet SQL Server audit and compliance requirements for all instances across your enterprise.
#Text=Buy now!
#Text=ApexSQL Manage: Manage your SQL Server inventory, perform health checks, documentation, and comparison.
#Text=Buy now!
#Text=ApexSQL Log: Read the SQL Server transaction logs to audit, replicate, and/or rollback changes.
#Text=Buy now!
#Text=ApexSQL Recover: Recover damaged, deleted, dropped, or lost data.
#Text=Buy now!
#Text=[Best Value] ApexSQL DBA Suite: All 9 ApexSQL DBA tools, combined 65% savings, free support, and upgrades for a year, more!
#Text=Buy now!
#Text=Offers expire on September 30, 2020.
#Text=Other news and fresh content
#Text=Here is some content posted since the last newsletter from the Solution center...
#Text=Executing a TempDB health check analysis of SQL Server instances - learn how to perform TempDB health checks for SQL Server instances to increase overall instance performance
#Text=Executing a health check analysis of the SQL Server instance Security category - this article covers part 1 of SQL instance security health check rules.
#Text=The insight is given into the first set of rules by using the 3rd party solution, ApexSQL Manage

#Text=Here are our most recent releases:
#Text=ApexSQL Database Power Tools for VS Code 2020 R6

#Text=This release of ApexSQL Database Power Tools for VS Code 2020 R6 comes with: Browsable code completion list for inserting MySQL and MariaDB keywords, database, schema, object, parameter, and variable names in the SQL statements.
#Text=Usability and quality improved with 10 bugs fixed
#Text=ApexSQL Data Diff for MySQL 2020
#Text=This release of ApexSQL Data Diff for MySQL 2020 comes with: MySQL data compare for databases.
#Text=MySQL Server 5.6 or higher support.
#Text=MariaDB Server 10.1 and higher support.
#Text=Azure Database for MySQL support.
#Text=Azure Database for MariaDB support.
#Text=Amazon RDS for MySQL support.
#Text=Amazon RDS for MariaDB support.

#Text=Comparison options: Ignore case in table/view names, Ignore case in text data types, Ignore underscores in table/view names, Ignore new objects, Ignore leading and trailing spaces, Treat empty strings and nulls as equal.
#Text=Synchronization options: Script Use for database.
#Text=Object types to compare: Tables and views.
#Text=Object mapping.
#Text=Object filter.
#Text=Export comparison results into 3 output types: HTML, CSV and Excel.
#Text=Command line interface.
#Text=GUI themes.
#Text=High DPI and 4K resolution support.
#Text=Visual Language Dictionary for Visual Studio for iconography and other imagery concepts applied.
#Text=Application telemetry collects anonymous data on the use and performance of applications and application components.
#Text=ApexSQL Updater configures advanced updating settings of all installed ApexSQL products
#Text=ApexSQL Model 2020
#Text=This release of ApexSQL Model 2020 comes with: Application telemetry now collects anonymous data on the use and performance of applications and application components.
#Text=New ApexSQL Updater allows users to configure advanced updating settings of all installed ApexSQL products.
#Text=Usability and quality improved with 1 bug fixed
#Text=ApexSQL DevOps toolkit 2020 R6
#Text=This release of ApexSQL DevOps toolkit 2020 R6 comes with: TeamCity plug-in: Support for TeamCity 2020.01.
